name: disconnected
content:
disconnected adjective
(SEPARATE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not related, or not having any clear purpose or pattern: These are disconnected events, of no wider significance. disconnected thoughts
separate from someone or something else, and not fitting well together or understanding each other: disconnected from We have become disconnected from the natural world. At first, living far from his family gave him a disconnected feeling.
More examplesFewer examplesWithout a unifying narrative, names and dates become almost meaningless, a random jumble of disconnected facts.The short poems have been brought together into a somewhat disconnected whole.The three parts of his argument feel a little disconnected.I feel so lonely and disconnected, you know?He became increasingly disturbed and disconnected from reality.
